author: wsjcom
title: Saudis Pushed Wahabism Well Before 1979
text:
Adel Al-Toraifi refers to 1979 as the year that Saudi society shifted toward Islam’s most conservative tenets (“The Saudis Take On Radical Islam,” op-ed, March 20). I lived in Riyadh starting shortly after the infamous Arab oil embargo to late 1976.
What didn’t seem to change was Saudi Islamic conservatism in the morals, lifestyle and the social realm. The great of influx of foreign workers and advisers, like myself, certainly ushered in a new wave of Western influence putting pressure on the Saudi way of life, but it didn’t...
